message_1:
A group of 50 patients were tested for the effectiveness of a certain medication. The survival times in weeks after administering the medication are shown in the table below. Use survival analysis to estimate the probability that a patient survives more than 8 weeks after taking the medication.

| Patient | Survival time (weeks) |
|---------|----------------------|
| 1       | 2                    |
| 2       | 3                    |
| 3       | 5                    |
| 4       | 6                    |
| 5       | 7                    |
| 6       | 7                    |
| 7       | 8                    |
| 8       | 9                    |
| 9       | 12                   |
| 10      | 12                   |
| 11      | 15                   |
| 12      | 18                   |
| 13      | 20                   |
| 14      | 22                   |
| 15      | 23                   |
| 16      | 23                   |
| 17      | 25                   |
| 18      | 25                   |
| 19      | 26                   |
| 20      | 28                   |
| 21      | 29                   |
| 22      | 30                   |
| 23      | 30                   |
| 24      | 31                   |
| 25      | 32                   |
| 26      | 32                   |
| 27      | 33                   |
| 28      | 34                   |
| 29      | 34                   |
| 30      | 35                   |
| 31      | 35                   |
| 32      | 35                   |
| 33      | 35                   |
| 34      | 36                   |
| 35      | 37                   |
| 36      | 38                   |
| 37      | 39                   |
| 38      | 40                   |
| 39      | 41                   |
| 40      | 42                   |
| 41      | 42                   |
| 42      | 42                   |

| 44      | 44                   |
| 45      | 45                   |
| 46      | 47                   |
| 47      | 48                   |
| 48      | 49                   |
| 49      | 49                   |
| 50      | 50                   |
message_2:
To estimate the probability that a patient survives more than 8 weeks after taking the medication, we will use the Kaplan-Meier estimator. First, we need to organize the data and calculate the number of patients at risk and the number of events (deaths) at each time point.

| Time (weeks) | Number at risk | Number of events |
|--------------|---------------|------------------|
| 2            | 50            | 1                |
| 3            | 49            | 1                |
| 5            | 48            | 1                |
| 6            | 47            | 1                |
| 7            | 46            | 2                |
| 8            | 44            | 1                |
| 9            | 43            | 1                |
| 12           | 42            | 2                |
| 15           | 40            | 1                |
| 18           | 39            | 1                |
| 20           | 38            | 1                |
| 22           | 37            | 1                |
| 23           | 36            | 2                |
| 25           | 34            | 2                |
| 26           | 32            | 1                |
| 28           | 31            | 1                |
| 29           | 30            | 1                |
| 30           | 29            | 2                |
| 31           | 27            | 1                |
| 32           | 26            | 2                |
| 33           | 24            | 1                |
| 34           | 23            | 2                |
| 35           | 21            | 4                |
| 36           | 17            | 1                |
| 37           | 16            | 1                |
| 38           | 15            | 1                |
| 39           | 14            | 1                |
| 40           | 13            | 1                |
| 41           | 12            | 1                |
| 42           | 11            | 3                |
| 43           | 8             | 1                |
| 44           | 7             | 1                |
| 45           | 6             | 1                |
| 47           | 5             | 1                |
| 48           | 4             | 1                |
| 49           | 3             | 2                |
| 50           | 1             | 1                |

Now, we will calculate the survival probabilities at each time point using the Kaplan-Meier estimator formula:

S(t) = (Number at risk - Number of events) / Number at risk

We will multiply the survival probabilities at each time point up to 8 weeks.

S(2) = 49/50
S(3) = 48/49
S(5) = 47/48
S(6) = 46/47
S(7) = 44/46
S(8) = 43/44

Now, we will multiply these probabilities to estimate the probability of surviving more than 8 weeks:

P(survive > 8 weeks) = S(2) * S(3) * S(5) * S(6) * S(7) * S(8)
P(survive > 8 weeks) = (49/50) * (48/49) * (47/48) * (46/47) * (44/46) * (43/44)
P(survive > 8 weeks) â‰ˆ 0.86

Therefore, the estimated probability that a patient survives more than 8 weeks after taking the medication is approximately 0.86 or 86%.
